mapotempo.com.mapotempo_fleet_android

Class MissionsFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • Fragment
      • mapotempo.com.mapotempo_fleet_android.MissionsFragment

  • public class MissionsFragment
extends Fragment
    This fragment is responsible for display all missions assigned to the user currently connected. Each view displayed by this fragment is composed of 3 main UI elements :
    • The name
    • The delivery date
    • The delivery hour

    Integration

    First and foremost, it is needed to implement the fragment through XML using the following class : <fragment class="mapotempo.com.mapotempo_fleet_android.MissionContainerFragment"

    This fragment require the implementation of MissionsFragment.OnMissionsInteractionListener directly in the Activity that hold the List Fragment. Then Override the MissionsFragment.OnMissionsInteractionListener.onListMissionsInteraction(int) which force to return an Android's click Listener. If you don't know about Event Listeners please check the documentation here : Android Listener
    Feel free to put any logic inside the listener. Keep in mind that the position returned can be used to get the detailed view of the mission triggered by a click.

    Here is an example of usability: 
          @Override
     public View.OnClickListener onListMissionsInteraction(final int position) {
         View.OnClickListener onClick = new View.OnClickListener() {
              @Override
             public void onClick(View v) {
                 intent = new Intent(v.getContext(), YouNewActivity.class);
                 intent.putExtra("mission_position", position);
                 v.getContext().startActivity(intent);
             }
         }
         return onClick;
    }
